ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Misty Thicket
ygData.msgSnippet: I d go with the short run kinda groups... I mean at these low levels you don t know who is just playing the game on weekends ...or who is too addicted to
ygData.messageBody:
I'd go with the short run kinda groups...
I mean at these low levels you don't know who is just playing the game on
weekends ...or who is too addicted to it...(me)

Oh and I know that there is a tunnel on the other side of the wall in the
back somewhere that will take you to another area
can't remember if you fight kobolds or orcs in there.

I went into Misty with my level 14 Druid and nothing there is remotely
green...cept guards


Sarakin 14th Level Druid on Bertoxx

> -----Original Message-----
> From: MLockridge01@... [SMTP:MLockridge01@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 30, 2001 4:20 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EverQuest] Misty Thicket
>
> I am a level 6 halfling warrior, first character. I am currently
> hunting just outside the gate of Misty Thicket. I can handle about
> 30% of what I meet, and with care I have not been killed lately.
>
> I cannot find my heading very well, so I am cautious going out too
> far. At the gates are deputies to take care of the big stuff, so I
> hunt nearby.
>
> Does anyone know if there is a zone at the other side of Misty
> Thicket?
>
> How nasty do things get out there? I don't expect to take on giant
> spiders too soon, but I don't want to play too timid, either.
>
> Any advise?
>
> I can group with other newbies for short runs, but I don't have the
> time to get a regular group together right now. Can these short term
> groups be very useful, or is it better to concentrate on solo stat
> building?
>
> Samwiseguy
>
